required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Different Forms of Creatine
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacokinetic Assessment of Acute Ingestion of Different Forms of Creatine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the pharmacokinetics of creatine nitrate supplementation.

detailed_description.textblock: Creatine nitrate contains several nutrients that may increase anaerobic exercise performance. Theoretically, dietary supplementation of creatine nitrate during resistance training can improve the quality of training leading to greater changes in strength, power and fat free mass. Endothelial function measured by flow-mediated dilation (FMD), a non-invasive vascular health parameter that can be measured via ultrasonography, is a predictor of cardiovascular disease risk which precedes traditional risk markers. Diet, physical activity and pharmaceutical interventions can all impact vascular function and health. The purpose of this study is to determine the acute vascular response of creatine nitrate supplementation on FMD by analyzing the pharmacokinetics of creatine nitrate supplementation.

primary_outcome.measure: Examine creatine vs. creatine nitrate supplementation by assessing body water
Examine creatine vs. creatine nitrate supplementation by assessing body composition
Examine creatine vs. creatine nitrate supplementation by assessing serum creatine levels
Examine creatine vs. creatine nitrate supplementation by assessing serum nitrate levels
Examine creatine vs. creatine nitrate supplementation by assessing serum nitrite levels
Examine creatine vs. creatine nitrate supplementation by assessing flow-mediated dilation (FMD) via ultrasonography

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure standard clinical chemistry panels in the blood to evaluate safety
Measure side effects to evaluate safety utilizing a side effects questionnaire
Measure heart rate to evaluate safety
Measure blood pressure to evaluate safety

arm_group.description: 1 gm creatine monohydrate, 0.5 gm nitrate, 5 gm dextrose
2 gm creatine monohydrate, 1 gm nitrate, 3.5 gm dextrose

intervention.description: Creatine monohydrate (5.0 g creatine monohydrate, 1.5 g dextrose)
Creatine nitrate-1 (1.0 g creatine monohydrate, 0.5 g nitrate, 5.0 g dextrose)
Creatine nitrate-2 (2.0 g creatine monohydrate, 1.0 g nitrate, 3.5 g dextrose)
